content: mosaic crochet pattern dancing squares us terminology general info modern geometric mosaic crochet pattern dancing squares that allows you to create nearly anything you want blanket afghan scarf bag cushion cover… the pattern includes 2 different sections that you can repeat as many times as you want so your creation can be as wide and as long as you wish it s recommended to use two or more contrasting same weight yarn colors the chart is created using 2 colors for the symmetry i advice to finish your work with r23 experience level confident beginner language & terminology english us the pattern includes  introduction information about mosaic crochet  links to video tutorials of mosaic crochet basics  chart sample with written instructions to help to learn to read charts  chart  pictures stitches & abbreviations chain/chs chain/chains st/sts stitch/stitches r/rs row/row single_crochet single_crochet blsc back loop single crochet fldc front loop double_crochet if you wish to get a more textured result you can replace fldc with fpdc be sure you make a stitch a bit longer to have the same height with other sts in the row mosaic crochet basics basic technique  each row is worked in one color  always work from the front side only  cut the yarn and fasten_off after each r  single_crochet is worked only at the 1st r working into foundation chain as well as 1st and last st on each r  all blsc are worked into next st of previous r all fldc are worked into next st 2rs below © bebablanket | innovative crochet designs 1 reading charts  the charts include a legend identifying what the symbols mean  when reading charts do not pay attention to the color of a square it is just for your reference so you know what result you should get you have to pay attention to row number which color to use for that row and empty square blsc a square with a slash only the first and the last sts single_crochet x fldc 2rs below © bebablanket | innovative crochet designs 2 tips and tricks  use yarn that does not split  contrasting colors will define the design better  if you crochet loosely choose a smaller hook size  use a ruler to hide the row that you worked already  use a stitch marker to mark the last st of each repeat it will help you to follow the chart and not to get lost  before you start the project think about the yarn tails do you want to hide them as you go to leave as a fringe or you will work a double border  if you plan to leave tails as a fringe keep them more or less the same length i measure with my palm before attaching new yarn into the first st and after i finish the last st on each row useful links  how to hide tails
